 Well I'm HOPING the Cardinals can do it but I don't see it happening. Their pitching is simply horrible now.
 
 Realistically it looks like the Mets in the NL. The Yankees are also looking like the team to beat although the Tigers could give them a run for their money.
 
 Assuming they can keep it up, the Mets look like almost a lock to take the NL. Of course as you know, anything can happen in the playoffs. I would have said the Yankees were a lock up 3-0 on the Red Sox and bringing in Mariano Rivera, one of the best closers of all time. There's really only one way to find out.

well with most teams having only 1 game left, there are still a few races that are up in the air.
 
 First games of the playoffs:
 
 Detroit-Minnesota @ New York Yankees
 If Minnesota wins OR Detroit loses, it will be Detroit here, otherwise Minnesota
 
 Oakland @ Detroit-Minnesota
 Whoever doesn't play in the above game will be playing here. Pretty sad how the wild card team in the Central will have a better record than Oakland (the West winner) but that's the way it works I guess.
 
 San Diego-Los Angeles Dodgers @ New York Mets
 If the Dodgers win or San Diego loses it will be San Diego here, otherwise the Dodgers.
 
 St. Louis-Houston @ Los Angeles Dodgers-San Diego
 If the Dodgers win or San Diego loses it will be the Dodgers here, otherwise San Diego. The other race is a bit more interesting. The Cardinals have 2 games left and Houston only has one. If St. Louis can pick up a win either day or if Houston loses their only remaining game, St. Louis will be here. Otherwise Houston has completed one of the most miraculous combacks ever. It will be very interesting.

OK, here are my playoff predictions.
 
 Detroit's playing Kansas City and Minnesota is playing the White Sox. Kansas City is a pretty horrible team, but they've been scoring a lot of runs recently. Also the White Sox are already out and the Twins will be playing for a shot to play the A's rather than the Yankees AND have home field advantage. I can't even guess how the Detroit game will play out, but I see the Twins picking up the win and clinching the AL Central.
 
 St. Louis has 2 games left, and winning one of them clinches the NL Central. Carpenter, seemingly their only ace left, looks to come into this crucial game and pick up the win against Villanueva (1-2) in the clutch. This will render the other 2 games irrelevant.
 
 The Dodgers-Giants and the Padres-DBacks games should be great games. They all seem to have their aces on the mound. We've got Lowe vs. Schmidt and Williams vs. Webb. Between the Dodgers' hot streak against a not so great Giants team and San Diego going into Arizona taking on Webb, one of the best pitchers in the game, even though he is on a mediocre team, I see the Dodgers taking this one.
 
 Now for the actual matchups.
 
 Twins over A's - 5 games
 Yankees over Tigers - 7 games
 Mets over Padres - 5 games
 Cardinals over Dodgers - 7 games
 
 Yankees over Twins - 6 games
 Mets over Cardinals - 4 games
 
 World Series - Mets over Yankees - 6 games
Atlanta 3, Houston 1. Cardinals are going to the playoffs!!!
Twins 5, White Sox 1. Twins win the division

Twins 5, White Sox 1. Twins win the division

 Well now it's irrelevant anyway since Detroit lost but I think the Twins had the tiebreaker. From the standings I was looking at it said the Twins' magic number was 1, meaning that when they won they clinched. I believe the tiebreaker is head-to-head and I don't know they did against each other, but I guess that means the Twins did better in their games against Detroit.
The Twins win the division because the Royals swept the Tigers, giving Minnesota one more win than Detroit. Unbelievable!

Wow, I can't believe I didn't remember the first round was a 5-game series. I also messed up the tiebreaking stuff with the Padres and Dodgers, so even though I was right in that the Padres didn't gain a game on the Dodgers, they still won the tiebreaker. So for the first round:
 
 Yankees over Tigers in 5
 Twins over A's in 4
 Cardinals over Padres in 4
 Mets over Dodgers in 3

Now for the actual matchups.
 
 Twins over A's - 5 games
 Yankees over Tigers - 7 games
 Mets over Padres - 5 games
 Cardinals over Dodgers - 7 games
 
 Yankees over Twins - 6 games
 Mets over Cardinals - 4 games
 
 World Series - Mets over Yankees - 6 games

Well Detroit swept the A's and will be very well-rested when they play in the World Series. St. Louis took a 2-1 lead tonight, Suppan pitched beautifully. Now come the pitching adventures for both teams. That will be the main concern. Detroit has pretty solid pitching and will be very well-rested. Depending on how long the NL series goes we're most likely going to see a tired pitching staff not particularly deep. So can the bottom pitchers in the rotation for the Cards and Mets come through and step up for the playoffs? Unless they can the Tigers will take the series with relative ease. But if they can, watch out Detroit.
We're finally there. Detroit vs. St. Louis for all the marbles.
Kenny Rogers has saved his best pitching for the end of his career. He has played 18 seasons. Will he be back next year?
